Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.function

Interface ThrowingBiFunction<T,​U,​R,​E extends Exception>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the 1st argument
    U - The type of the 2nd argument
    R - The type of the return value
    E - The type of the exception potentially being thrown
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ThrowingBiFunction<T,​U,​R,​E extends Exception>
    An alternative to Java's BiFunction interface where the apply method is allowed to throw a checked exception.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      R apply​(T arg0, U arg1)
      Calculates a value for the provided argument while potentially throwing an exception of type E.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        R apply​(T arg0,
        U arg1)
 throws E extends Exception
        Calculates a value for the provided argument while potentially throwing an exception of type E.
        Parameters:
        arg0 - The 1st argument
        arg1 - The 2nd argument
        Returns:
        A value of type R
        Throws:
        E - The exception potentially being thrown
        E extends Exception
